summary: This is an internal email from a Captain at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, reminding Lieutenants to conduct required daily rounds inside the PCU (likely Protective Custody Unit or similar). The sender notes that recent round sheets look bad and expresses concern about an upcoming Program Review, emphasizing the need to avoid preventable issues.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Author of the email, reminding Lieutenants to conduct daily rounds inside the PCU and expressing concern about recent performance and an upcoming Program Review.

events.title: Upcoming Program Review at MCC
events.description: An unspecified Program Review is mentioned as being close, with concern expressed about avoiding unnecessary hits that could have been prevented.

locations.address: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 1W07
locations.context: The federal detention facility in New York where the correspondence originates and where the PCU rounds are to be conducted.

keyFacts: The document is internal correspondence from a Captain at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
It highlights operational concerns about daily Lieutenant rounds inside the PCU (Protective Custody Unit or similar), noting that recent round sheets 'look bad'.
It references an upcoming 'Program Review' and stresses the need to avoid preventable issues that could result in negative marks.
The document underscores internal procedural and oversight pressures within the MCC facility.
